publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.article-title: “Leveraging Federal Law to Support Decision Making in Homeland Defense Operations”
title-group.subtitle: Luncheon Remarks to MORS “Workshop: Homeland Security – Homeland Defense Decision Support”

bio.p: Lieutenant Commander Odom currently serves as Deputy Legal Advisor to the Deputy Chief of Naval Operations (Information, Plans, and Strategy) (N3/N5), where he provides the legal review of strategies, plans, orders, and agreements related to homeland defense and homeland security. Lieutenant Commander Odom previously served for three years as an instructor at the Naval Justice School where he taught international and operational law, including the school’s Homeland Defense and Homeland Security curriculum. He earned a Bachelor of Arts from Duke University and a Juris Doctorate from Wake Forest University School of Law.
